attributes.action: Prohibit ‘Vaccine Passports’ now (or any derivative purporting the same)
attributes.additional_details:
When not in a state of ‘National Emergency’, freedom of domestic movement, rights to employment and enjoyment of reasonable activities (e.g. frequenting restaurants, leisure centres and shopping malls) are fundamental basic rights and must not be prohibited if a person has not been inoculated with - for example Coronavirus vaccine(s).

Any restriction of these rights, as a result of the possible introduction of a ‘Vaccine Passport’ (or other derivative) must be deemed unlawful now.
attributes.background: Parliament to pass concise legislation prohibiting the introduction of any future Vaccine Passports; specifically in relation to movement (travel - unless prohibited by another nation), employment and enjoyment of social/leisure activities. It is an individual right to accept or deny vaccines.
